maml:description.maml:para: Builds one or more .bicep files.
Build-Bicep is equivalent to the Bicep CLI command 'bicep build' but with some additional features.

- Compile all files in a directory - Generate ARM Template Parameter files - Output ARM Template directly as string or hashtable without writing to file
Any error or warning from bicep will be written to the information stream. To save output in a variable, use stream redirection. See example below.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled
The -AsHashtable prints all output as a hashtable instead of corresponding files.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a .bicep file to exclude from compilation
Skips trying to restore dependent modules
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled
The -AsString prints all output as a string instead of corresponding files.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a .bicep file to exclude from compilation
Skips trying to restore dependent modules
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled
Specifies the target directory where the compiled files should be created
Compress the built ARM Template to reduce file size
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a .bicep file to exclude from compilation
Generate an ARM template parameter file with all parameters from the bicep file.
Generate an ARM template parameter file with the required parameters from the bicep file.
Skips trying to restore dependent modules
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled
Specify the filename of the generated ARM template.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Generate an ARM template parameter file with all parameters from the bicep file.
Generate an ARM template parameter file with the required parameters from the bicep file.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The -AsHashtable prints all output as a hashtable instead of corresponding files.
The -AsString prints all output as a string instead of corresponding files.
Compress the built ARM Template to reduce file size
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies a .bicep file to exclude from compilation
Generate an ARM template parameter file with all parameters from the bicep file.
Generate an ARM template parameter file with the required parameters from the bicep file.
Skips trying to restore dependent modules
Specifies the target directory where the compiled files should be created
Specify the filename of the generated ARM template.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled

maml:description.maml:para: Builds one or more .bicepparam files.
Build-BicepParam is equivalent to the Bicep CLI command 'bicep build-params' but with some additional features.

- Compile all bicepparam files in a directory - Output ARM Template parameters directly as string or hashtable without writing to file Any error or warning from bicep will be written to the information stream. To save output in a variable, use stream redirection. See example below.
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be compiled
The -AsHashtable prints all output as a hashtable instead of corresponding files.

maml:description.maml:para: Clear the local module cache.
Command to clear all or parts of the local module cache. Supports clearing both modules cached from private registries and template specs.
Clear the entire cache
Clear the cache for Bicep private registries
Specifies which module registry to clear
Specifies the repository to clear
Specifies which version of a cached module to clear
Clear the cache for template specs
Specifies which subscription to clear
Specifies which resource group to clear
Specifies which template spec to clear
Specifies which version of a cached module to clear
Clear the entire cache
Clear the cache for Bicep private registries
Specifies which module registry to clear
Specifies the repository to clear
Specifies which resource group to clear
Specifies which template spec to clear
Specifies which subscription to clear
Clear the cache for template specs
Specifies which version of a cached module to clear

command:example.maml:title: - Example 1 - Clear all cached modules from private registries -

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all modules cached from private module registries (ACR).

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 2 - Clear all cached modules from template specs ---

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all cached template specs.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3 - Clear all cached modules from a specific private registry

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all modules cached from private module registry mymodules.azurecr.io

command:example.maml:title: Example 4 - Clear all cached modules from a template specs for a specific subscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all cached from template specs for a specific subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5 - Removes a specific module from local module cache

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all cached versions of the module (repository) `Storage` from mymodules.azurecr.io.

command:example.maml:title: Example 6 - Removes a specific version from local module cache

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes version `v2` of the module (repository) `Storage` from mymodules.azurecr.io.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert Bicep parameters from v0.1-0.2 style to decorator style.

>NOTE: This command has been decommissioned since parameter modifiers are no longer supported starting with Bicep 0.4. If you have old bicep files that you need to update to use decorator style parameters use version 1.4.7 of the module that is using an older Bicep version.
This command convert Bicep parameters from v0.1-0.2 style to decorator style using a bicep file as input.
Specfies the path to the file with parameters to convert
Saves the converted params to the clipboard.
Specfies the path to the file with parameters to convert
Saves the converted params to the clipboard.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Convert parameters from one bicep file to decorator style parameters

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example takes a bicep file as input and converts all parameters to decorator style parameters and outputs the result.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Convert parameters from one bicep file to decorator style parameters and save to clipboard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example takes a bicep file as input and converts all parameters to decorator style parameters saves the result to the clipboard.

maml:description.maml:para: Convert a JSON string or file to Bicep
This command converts any valid JSON object to Bicep Language format
Specifies the JSON file to convert to Bicep Language
Copies the result to the clipboard.
Specifies the JSON string to convert to Bicep Language
Copies the result to the clipboard.
Specifies the JSON file to convert to Bicep Language
Specifies the JSON string to convert to Bicep Language
Copies the result to the clipboard.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example converts a simple JSON object to Bicep Language

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 2: Convert a json array to Bicep Language ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example converts a JSON array to Bicep Language

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 3: Read a file and convert to Bicep Language -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example converts a JSON file to Bicep Language

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 4: Converts a JSON-file to bicep -----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example converts a JSON file to Bicep Language

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Converts a JSON-file to bicep and saves it to the Clipboard

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example converts a JSON file to Bicep Language and saves it to the Clipboard

maml:description.maml:para: Decompile ARM templates to .bicep files
ConvertTo-Bicep is equivalent to 'bicep decompile' but with some additional features.
-Decompile all ARM templates in a directory -Specify output directory
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be decompiled
Specifies the path to the directory where the compiled files should be outputted
-AsString prints all output as a string instead of corresponding files.
Force overwriting of output files. If the output.bicep file already exists and -Force is not set we will not overwrite the resulting file.
-AsString prints all output as a string instead of corresponding files.
Force overwriting of output files. If the output.bicep file already exists and -Force is not set we will not overwrite the resulting file.
Specifies the path to the directory where the compiled files should be outputted
Specfies the path to the directory or file that should be decompiled

maml:description.maml:para: Get ARM Template reference docs for provided resource type.
Get-BicepApiReference is a command to find and open the ARM template reference documentation in a browser for the provided resource type.
Specifies the Api Version to use. If no API Version is provided the latest will be used.
Can be used to specify which child resource to get the docs for.
Use this parameter to try to force open docs that can't be found.
Specify which resource from a resource provider to get the docs for.
Specifies which Resource Provider to get the docs for.
If set, the command will output the api documentation URI instead of opening a browser.
Use -Type to find docs using the Bicep types format used when defining a resource in a Bicep template.
Use this parameter to try to force open docs that can't be found.
Open the latest API version when using the types information.
Open the latest API version when using the types information.
If set, the command will output the api documentation URI instead of opening a browser.
Specifies the Api Version to use. If no API Version is provided the latest will be used.
Can be used to specify which child resource to get the docs for.
Use this parameter to try to force open docs that can't be found.
Open the latest API version when using the types information.
Specify which resource from a resource provider to get the docs for.
Specifies which Resource Provider to get the docs for.
Use -Type to find docs using the Bicep types format used when defining a resource in a Bicep template.
Open the latest API version when using the types information.
If set, the command will output the api documentation URI instead of opening a browser.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get ARM template reference documentation using the Bicep types format

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will open the documentation for the `Microsoft.Network` resource provider, resource `virtualNetworks` and API Version `2020-06-01` in a browser.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get the latest ARM template reference for a resource type

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will open the documentation for the `Microsoft.Storage` resource provider, resource `storageAccounts` using the latest API Version in a browser.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get the ARM template reference for a resource type using a specific API Version

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will open the documentation for the `Microsoft.Storage` resource provider, resource `storageAccounts` using the ´2018-11-01` API Version in a browser.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get the ARM template reference for a child resource

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will open the documentation for the `Microsoft.Compute` resource provider, resource `virtualMachines/extensions`

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Get the latest ARM template reference documentation using the Bicep types format

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will open the documentation for the `Microsoft.Network` resource provider, resource `virtualNetworks` and use the latest API Version instead of the provided version `2020-06-01`.

maml:description.maml:para: Get bicep configuration (bicepconfig.json) in use for a bicep file.

Returns the default bicep configuration
Returns the settings in the local bicepconfig.json file
Path to a bicep file
Returns the merged settings from the local bicepconfig.json file and the default settings

maml:description.maml:para: Create markdown documentation for bicep files
This command creates a basic markdown documentation of one or more bicep files.
Bicep file to create documentation from
Output the resulting markdown to to the cosole as string.
NOT IMPLEMENTED!
Path to folder containing bicep files. All files in folder will have markdown documentation created.
Output the resulting markdown to to the cosole as string.
NOT IMPLEMENTED!
Search recursively for .bicep files.
Output the resulting markdown to to the cosole as string.
Bicep file to create documentation from
NOT IMPLEMENTED!
Path to folder containing bicep files. All files in folder will have markdown documentation created.
Search recursively for .bicep files.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will create a file called `c:\MyBicepFile.md` containing basic documentation.

This command will traverse the c:\MyBicepFiles\ folder, including subfolders, and create documentation for all bicep files. The markdown files will be saved with the same name as the bicep files, using .md file extension.

maml:description.maml:para: Publishes a .bicep file to the module registry.
Publishes .bicep files to the module registry repository specified.
Specifies which bicep file to publish.
Specifies the target registry, repository and tag.
Specifies which bicep file to publish.
Specifies the target registry, repository and tag.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Publishes storage.bicep as a module in the private module registry psbicep.azurecr.io, to the repository bicep/storage using the v1 tag.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores external modules from the specified Bicep file to the local module cache.

Restores all external modules referenced in the .bicep file to the local module cache. Modules from an ACR bicep registry is stored under '%USERPROFILE%\.bicep\br' and template spec modules '%USERPROFILE%\.bicep\ts'.
Bicep file to restore.
Bicep file to restore.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Restores all external modules used in main.bicep to the local module cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Tests if a bicep file is valid.
Tests if a bicep file is valid. Returns true/false by default, but can be made to return JSON output.
Path to a bicep file to test.
Set format for output. Simple will only return true or false.

Set the highest level of diagnostic output that will be accepted for the test to pass. Setting Warning here will make a bicep file with errors fail the test while a bicep files with warnings will be tested valid.
Settings this to Error will accept anything. Since this is not a wanted scenario the command will throw an error.
Will run silently, not outputing any diagnostic information to the information stream.

Set the highest level of diagnostic output that will be accepted for the test to pass. Setting Warning here will make a bicep file with errors fail the test while a bicep files with warnings will be tested valid.
Settings this to Error will accept anything. Since this is not a wanted scenario the command will throw an error.
Will run silently, not outputing any diagnostic information to the information stream.
Set format for output. Simple will only return true or false.
Path to a bicep file to test.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns true if the bicep file has no errors or warnings.
Returns true if the bicep file has no errors.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstall Bicep CLI (Windows only)
Uninstall-BicepCLI uninstalls all Bicep CLI versions installed (Windows Installer and PowerShell installations)
This switch will force Bicep to be uninstalled.
This switch will force Bicep to be uninstalled.

command:example.maml:title: ---------------- Example 1: Uninstall Bicep CLI ----------------

maml:description.maml:para: Update Bicep CLI (Windows only)
Update-BicepCLI is a command to update to the latest Bicep CLI release available from the Azure/Bicep repo.

maml:alert.maml:para: Go to module repository <https://github.com/PSBicep/PSBicep> for detailed info, reporting issues and to submit contributions.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates existing ARM Template parameter file based on a bicep file.
Updates a parameter file with new parameters, without removing existing values. Also removes parameters from the parameter file if they have been removed from the bicep file.
Path to the parameters.json file that needs updating.
Path to the bicep file which the parameter file should be updated from.
Whether or not to update the parameter file with all parameters or only the required ones.
Path to the bicep file which the parameter file should be updated from.
Whether or not to update the parameter file with all parameters or only the required ones.
Path to the parameters.json file that needs updating.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update a parameter file vnet.parameters.json, without specifying the name of the bicep file. It will look for a bicep file in the same directory with a name based on the parameterfile. In this case vnet.bicep.
Update a parameter file vnet.parameters.json, specifying the location of the bicep file.

maml:description.maml:para: Update Bicep Types data
Update-BicepTypes is a command to update the Bicep Types data used by command Get-BicepApiReference
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
